intro: Wahlenbergia serpyllifolia, commonly known as the common bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy blue or purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. It has slender, upright stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Wahlenbergia serpyllifolia is known for its resilience and ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
